intro: Fumaria racemosa, commonly known as common whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which are characteristic of its species. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Fumaria racemosa is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
